channel.title: What programing lang would it be easiest to write in?
channel.description:
ok,
if you were to make a 3d model viewer/interactive thing (ex, rotate,translate,resize), what language would you make it in? (which one would be the easiest to do so in?)
i though C, but people are saying java is much better to do this than C.
your comments (don't be biased please)

item.title: What programing lang would it be easiest to write in?
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

I would recommend using C# with an OpenGL wrapper like Tao. You won’t have to write any 3d math code and the obj file format is piss easy to parse.

abraham is right however, the language doesn’t make a difference for an application this small.

Read full topic
item.source: What programing lang would it be easiest to write in?

item.title: What programing lang would it be easiest to write in?
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

just use any popular lib, i would recommend jME for java and ogre3d for c++

Read full topic
item.source: What programing lang would it be easiest to write in?

item.title: What programing lang would it be easiest to write in?
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

This is actually a very small application and the language you use really doesn’t make a difference. The only thing you are doing is parsing a file and performing some calculations. Get on with it.

Read full topic

item.title: What programing lang would it be easiest to write in?
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

SETO:

i don’t want to go really from scratch, as you said OpenGL for rendering and such

wait what? opengl is hardly from scratch, doing it from scratch would be to write the 3d drawing shit yourself

Read full topic
item.source: What programing lang would it be easiest to write in?

item.title: What programing lang would it be easiest to write in?
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

You do know that it’s trivial to implement all this functionality in your engine when it’s already included in the graphics library you are using (and quite better than how any average programmer would implement it).

Read full topic
item.source: What programing lang would it be easiest to write in?

item.source: What programing lang would it be easiest to write in?

item.title: What programing lang would it be easiest to write in?
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:
@abraham2119 wrote:

C would be fine, and use OpenGL just for rendering and anything else can be done by your engine (rotations, resize, etc)

Back when I started learning C, I wrote an OBJ parser and rendered the model using OpenGL, I then added a semi-functional rotation system. Although it was horribly programmed since I was new at C, it was still pretty easy to develop. Also, it had the plus of using very, very little memory.

Read full topic
item.source: What programing lang would it be easiest to write in?

item.source: What programing lang would it be easiest to write in?

item.title: What programing lang would it be easiest to write in?
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

You will not find an unbiased answer to this question…so here’s my biased answer: C#. It’s fast, it’s cross platform, and is probably the most modern of the widely used statically typed object oriented languages (though funnily enough it supports dynamic typing too now).

How much from scratch do you actually want to do though? You will probably want to use OpenGL for rendering even if you implement your own 3d math and just use GL in 2d.

Read full topic
item.source: What programing lang would it be easiest to write in?
